1.brief: properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to inhale eagerly; figuratively, to cover; by implication, to be angry; also to hasten
a man in general (singly or collectively)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to feed on; figuratively, to consume; by implication, to battle (as destruction)
properly, to press, i.e. (figuratively) to distress

to be hostile (only active participle an opponent)

altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)

3.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
near, with or among; often in general, to
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure

to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman

5.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
properly, to carve, i.e. fabricate or fashion; hence (in a bad sense) to worry, pain or anger
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a contrivance, i.e. (concretely) a texture, machine, or (abstractly) intention, plan (whether bad, a plot; or good, advice)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

6.brief: properly, to turn aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. sojourn (as a guest); also to shrink, fear (as in a strange place); also to gather forhostility (as afraid)
to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk
a heel (as protuberant); hence, a track; figuratively, the rear (of an army)
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

7.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

8.brief: properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, writing (the art or a document); by implication, a book

9.brief: at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a promise (to God); also (concretely) a thing promised

to snatch away, whether in a good or a bad sense
